ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.2_0: On one occasion on the observance day, he was seated surrounded by the Sangha of monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.3_0: Then, when the night was well advanced and the first part of the night was over, Venerable Ānanda got up from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and said to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.4_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the first watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.5_0: may the Fortunate One, venerable Sir, recite the Pātimokkha for the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.6_0: When this was said, the Fortunate One remained silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.7_0: At the end of the last part of the night, when the sky was flaring up at dawn, he asked a second
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.8_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the middle watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.9_0: may the Fortunate One, venerable Sir, recite the Pātimokkha for the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.10_0: But for a second time the Buddha kept silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.11_0: At the end of the last part of the night, when the sky was flaring up at dawn, he asked a third time.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.12_0: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the last watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.13_0: may the Fortunate One, venerable Sir, recite the Pātimokkha for the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.1.14_0: And the Buddha replied, “Ānanda, the gathering is impure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.4_0: Then he focused on comprehending the minds of everyone in the Saṅgha.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.5_0: And he saw that person—immoral, with bad qualities, impure and dubious in conduct, hiding his actions, not an ascetic while claiming to be one, not abstaining from sexuality while claiming to do so, rotten inside, lustful, defiled—seated in the midst of the Sangha of monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.6_0: He went up to him and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.7_0: he asked that monk to leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.8_0: You can’t live in communion with the mendicants.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.11_0: he asked that monk to leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.12_0: You can’t live in communion with the mendicants.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.13_0: For a second time that person was silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.15_0: he asked that monk to leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.16_0: You can’t live in communion with the mendicants.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.17_0: For a third time that person was silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.18_0: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna took that person by the arm, ejected him out the gate, and bolted the door. Then he went up to the Buddha, and said to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.21_0: may the Fortunate One, venerable Sir, recite the Pātimokkha for the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.22_0: “It’s amazing, Moggallāna, how that fool waited until he was grabbed by the arms.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.2.23_0: The Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.1_0: “Monks, the antigods delight in the ocean when they see these eight amazing qualities in it:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.3_0: The ocean slopes and inclines gradually. It does not drop off all at once.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.4_0: The ocean gradually slants, slopes, and inclines, with no abrupt precipice.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.5_0: This is the first thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.6_0: The ocean is steady. It does not go beyond the shoreline.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.7_0: The ocean is consistent and doesn’t overflow its boundaries,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.8_0: This is the second thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.9_0: Furthermore, the ocean does not endure a dead corpse,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.9_1: but quickly carries it to the shore and strands it on the beach.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.10_0: When it is swallowed by the ocean, it’s quickly carries off the cream,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.11_0: This is the third thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.12_0: When the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī—reach the ocean, they lose their former names and become known simply as the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.13_0: When the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī—reach the ocean, they lose their former names and become known simply as the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.14_0: This is the fourth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.15_0: Whatever rivers in the world flow into the ocean and whatever rain falls into it, the ocean is not diminished or filled up because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.16_0: For all the world’s streams that reach it, and the rain that falls from the sky, the ocean never empties or fills up.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.17_0: This is the fifth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.18_0: Furthermore, monks, the great ocean has one taste, the taste of salt.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.19_0: The ocean has just one taste, the taste of salt.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.20_0: This is the sixth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.21_0: Furthermore, monks, the great ocean has many precious things,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.21_1: Here are these treasures: beryl, mother-of-pearl, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, and cat’s eyes.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.22_0: The ocean is full of many kinds of treasures, such as pearls, gems, beryl, conch, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, and emeralds.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.23_0: This is the seventh thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.24_0: Furthermore, many great beings live in the ocean, such as leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.24_1: This is the name of the Gandhabbas, there are three kinds of scents, namely, the dragons, and fairies.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.24_2: individuals of three hundred leagues, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.25_0: There are great beings that are great beings, such as leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.25_1: There are in the ocean individuals of a hundred leagues.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.26_0: This is the eighth thing the demons love about the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.3.27_0: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things the demons love the ocean.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.0_0: In this teaching and training the training
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.1_0: “Just so, the monks delight in this spiritual path when they see these eight amazing qualities in it:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.3_0: Just as the ocean slopes and inclines gradually, and does not drop off all at once,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.4_0: In the same way in this teaching and training the penetration to enlightenment comes from gradual training, progress, and practice, not abruptly.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.5_0: In this teaching and training the penetration to enlightenment comes from gradual training, progress, and practice, not abruptly.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.6_0: This is the first thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.7_0: Just as the ocean is steady and does not go beyond the shoreline,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.8_0: In the same way, when a training rule is laid down for my disciples they wouldn’t break it even for the sake of their own life.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.9_0: Since I laid down this training rule for my disciples they wouldn’t break it even for the sake of their own life.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.10_0: This is the second thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.11_0: It’s like a dead corpse doesn’t quickly stir it up in the ocean. If it makes a tortoise, it quickly evaporates and embers it.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.12_0: so too, the Sangha of monks does not associate with anyone who is immoral—someone with bad qualities, impure and dubious in conduct, hiding his actions, not an ascetic while claiming to be one, not abstaining from sexuality while claiming to do so, rotten inside, lustful, defiled.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.12_1: is then far from the Community, and the Community from him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.13_0: and the Sangha of monks does not associate with him.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.14_0: This is the third thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.15_0: Furthermore, when the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī—reach the ocean, they lose their former names and become known simply as the ocean.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.16_0: In the same way, there are these four castes:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.16_1: They go forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One—whether Sakyan ascetics, brahmins, and merchants—
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.17_0: When anyone who goes forth on this spiritual path made known by the Buddha—whether aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, or workers—they lose their former name and class and become known simply as Sakyans ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.18_0: This is the fourth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.19_0: Just as the ocean does not decrease or fill up because of all the rivers in the world that flow into it or the rain that falls into it,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.20_0: so too, even if many monks are extinguished without remainder, there is no decrease or filling up of the element of extinguishment.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.21_0: Even if many monks are extinguished without remainder, there is no decrease or filling up of the element of extinguishment.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.22_0: This is the fifth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.23_0: Just as the ocean has only one taste, the taste of salt,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.24_0: so too, monks, this Dhamma and Discipline has one taste, the taste of freedom,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.25_0: This too is the oneness and freedom.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.26_0: This is the sixth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.27_0: Just as the ocean contains many precious things—pearls, gems, beryls, mother-of-pearls, quartz, corals, silver, gold, rubies, and cat’s eyes—
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.28_0: so, monks, this Dhamma and Discipline has many precious things, countless precious things,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.28_1: These are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakening factors, and the noble eightfold path.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.29_0: When this teaching and training is full of many kinds of treasures, this is the extremes.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.30_0: This is the seventh thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.31_0: Many great beings live in the ocean, such as leviathans, leviathan-gulpers, leviathan-gulper-gulpers, demons, dragons, and fairies. In the ocean there are life-forms a hundred leagues long, or even two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred leagues long.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.32_0: so too, great beings live in this teaching and training, and these are those beings.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.32_1: In this context, these are those beings.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.32_2: the once-returner, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of once-returning,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.32_3: the non-returner, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of non-returning,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.32_4: the Worthy One, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of Worthiness.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.33_0: When those beings live in this teaching and training, and these are those beings.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.33_1: the perfected one, and the one on the path to realize the fruit of perfection.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.34_0: This is the eighth thing the mendicants love about this teaching and training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.35_0: Seeing these eight incredible and amazing things, the mendicants love this teaching and training.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.36_0: Seeing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha exclaimed an inspired utterance:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.37_0: The rain saturates things that are covered up;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:1.4.40_0: And it will not be rained upon.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.1_0: The Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.2_0: “From now on I won’t do the observance-day procedure or recite the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.3_0: You will be doing it instead.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.4_0: It’s impossible, mendicants, it can’t happen that a Realized One could recite the monastic code in an impure assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.5_0: But you should not recite the Monastic Code while standing.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.7_0: If anyone who has an unconfessed offense listens to the Monastic Code, I allow you to cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.8_0: And it’s to be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.9_0: on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, a monk should announce:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.10_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:2.1.11_0: The person so-and-so has an unconfessed offense. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’ Then the Monastic Code is canceled for him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.2_0: thinking that nobody knew about them, the monks from the group of six listened to the Monastic Code while having unconfessed offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.3_0: The senior monks who could read the minds of others
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.5_0: thinking that nobody knew about them, the monks from the group of six listened to the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.9_0: thinking that nobody knew about them, the monks from the group of six listened to the Monastic Code while having unconfessed offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.11_0: that the monks leftovers of the house had canceled,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.12_0: the monks from the group of six canceled, without reason, the Monastic Code of the pure monks to preempt them.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.13_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.14_0: “How can the monks from the group of six cancel the Monastic Code of pure monks without reason?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.15_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.16_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six canceled the Monastic Code of pure monks without reason?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.17_0: “It’s true, Sir.” ... and the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.19_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.20_0: “You should not, without reason, cancel the Monastic Code of pure monks who don’t have any offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.1.21_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.0_0: Legitimate and illegitimate canceling of the Monastic Code
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.1_0: “One kind of canceling of the Monastic Code is illegitimate, one is legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.2_0: two kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, two are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.3_0: three kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, three are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.4_0: four kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, four are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.5_0: five kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, five are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.6_0: six kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, six are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.7_0: seven kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, seven are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.8_0: eight kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, eight are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.9_0: nine kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, nine are legitimate;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.2.10_0: ten kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code are illegitimate, ten are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.1_0: “What is the one kind of canceling of the Monastic Code that is illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.2_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for failure in morality.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.3_0: “This is the one kind of canceling of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.4_0: What is the one kind of canceling of the Monastic Code that is legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.5_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for failure in morality.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.6_0: This is the one kind of canceling of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.7_0: “What are the two kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.8_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for failure in morality or for failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.9_0: These are the two kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.10_0: What are the two kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.11_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for failure in morality or for failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.12_0: These are the two kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.13_0: “What are the three kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.14_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for failure in morality or for failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.15_0: These are the three kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.16_0: What are the three kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.17_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for failure in morality or for failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.18_0: These are the three kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.19_0: “What are the four kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.20_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for failure in morality, for failure in conduct, for failure in view, or for failure in livelihood.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.21_0: These are the four kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.22_0: What are the four kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.23_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for failure in morality, for failure in conduct, for failure in view, or for failure in livelihood.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.24_0: These are the four kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.25_0: “What are the five kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.26_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, groundlessly, for an offense entailing expulsion, for an offense entailing suspension,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.29_0: or for an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.30_0: These are the five kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.31_0: What are the five kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.32_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for an offense entailing expulsion, for an offense entailing suspension,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.35_0: or for an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.36_0: These are the five kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.37_0: “What are the six kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.38_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.39_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.40_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in view of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.41_0: These are the six kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.42_0: What are the six kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.43_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.44_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.45_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, or for the failure in view of one who has failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.47_0: These are the six kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.48_0: “What are the seven kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.49_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, groundlessly, for an offense entailing expulsion, for an offense entailing suspension,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.50_0: for a serious offense, for an offense entailing confession, for an offense entailing acknowledgment, for an offense of wrong conduct, or for an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.51_0: These are the seven kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.52_0: What are the seven kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.53_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for an offense entailing expulsion, for an offense entailing suspension,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.54_0: for a serious offense, for an offense entailing confession, for an offense entailing acknowledgment, for an offense of wrong conduct, or for an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.55_0: These are the seven kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.56_0: “What are the eight kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.57_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.58_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.59_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in view of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.60_0: for the failure in livelihood of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in livelihood of one who has failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.61_0: These are the eight kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.62_0: What are the eight kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.63_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.64_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.65_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in view of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.66_0: for the failure in livelihood of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in livelihood of one who has failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.67_0: These are the eight kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.68_0: “What are the nine kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.69_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, without grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed, for the failure in morality of one who both has and hasn’t failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.70_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.71_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in view of one who has failed, for the failure in view of one who both has and hasn’t failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.73_0: These are the nine kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.74_0: What are the nine kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.75_0: One cancels the Monastic Code, having grounds, for the failure in morality of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in morality of one who has failed, for the failure in morality of one who both has and hasn’t failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.76_0: for the failure in conduct of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in conduct of one who has failed,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.77_0: for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed, for the failure in view of one who has failed, for the failure in view of one who both has and hasn’t failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.79_0: These are the nine kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.80_0: “What are the ten kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.81_0: There is no-one seated in that gathering who has committed an offense entailing expulsion; there is no unfinished discussion on anyone committing an offense entailing expulsion;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.82_0: no-one seated in that gathering has renounced the training; there is no unfinished discussion on anyone renouncing the training;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.83_0: he goes to the legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly; he doesn’t reopen a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly; there is no unfinished discussion on the reopening of a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.84_0: He doesn’t have been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct, or suspected of failure in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.85_0: These are the ten kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.86_0: What are the ten kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.87_0: There is an offense entailing expulsion in that gathering who has committed an offense entailing expulsion; there is an unfinished discussion on anyone committing an offense entailing expulsion;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.88_0: someone seated in that gathering has renounced the training; there is an unfinished discussion on someone renouncing the training;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.89_0: he doesn’t go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly; he reopens a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly; there is an unfinished discussion on the reopening of a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.90_0: he has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality; he has seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.3.91_0: These are the ten kinds of canceling of the Monastic Code that are legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.1_0: “And how is one who has committed an offense entailing expulsion seated in that gathering?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone committing an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk committing an offense entailing expulsion, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.4_0: ‘The monk so-and-so has committed an offense entailing expulsion.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.5_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk committing an offense entailing expulsion, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.6_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.7_0: ‘I have committed an offense entailing expulsion.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.8_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.10_0: So-and-so has committed an offense entailing expulsion. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.11_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.12_0: “When the Monastic Code has been canceled for a monk, it may be that the gathering breaks up because of any one of ten dangers:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.13_0: danger from kings, danger from bandits, danger from fire, danger from floods, danger from people, danger from predatory animals, danger from snakes, a life-threatening danger, a danger to living the spiritual life, or danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.14_0: Then, if a monk wishes, he may, in that monastery or in another monastery, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.15_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.16_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so committing an offense entailing expulsion. The case has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.17_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should deliberate on that cloth.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.18_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.19_0: If not, then on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, a monk should announce:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.20_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.21_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so committing an offense entailing expulsion. The case has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.22_0: The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.4.23_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.1_0: “And how is one who has renounced the training seated in that gathering?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone renouncing the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk renouncing the training, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.4_0: ‘The monk so-and-so has renounced the training.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.5_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk renouncing the training, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.6_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.8_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.10_0: So-and-so has renounced the training. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.11_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.12_0: “When the Monastic Code has been canceled for a monk, it may be that the gathering breaks up because of any one of ten dangers:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.14_0: or danger to living the spiritual life. Then, if a monk wishes, he may, in that monastery or in another monastery, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.15_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.16_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so renouncing the training. The matter has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.17_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should deliberate on that cloth.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.18_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.19_0: If not, then on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, a monk should announce:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.20_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.21_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so renouncing the training. The matter has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.22_0: The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.5.23_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.1_0: “And how does he not go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who doesn’t go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk not going to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.4_0: ‘Monk so-and-so didn’t go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.5_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk not going to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.6_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.7_0: ‘I didn’t go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.8_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.10_0: So-and-so did not go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.6.11_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.1_0: “And how does he reopen a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who reopens a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk reopening a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.4_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk reopening a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly, nor does another monk inform him, but the monk himself informs him, ‘I have reopened a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.5_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.6_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.7_0: So-and-so did not go to a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.8_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.9_0: “When the Monastic Code has been canceled for a monk, it may be that the gathering breaks up because of any one of ten dangers:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.11_0: or danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.12_0: Then, if a monk wishes, he may, in that monastery or in another monastery, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.13_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.14_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so reopening a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly. The case has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.15_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should deliberate on that cloth.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.16_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.17_0: If not, then on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, a monk should announce:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.18_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.19_0: There is an unfinished discussion on so-and-so reopening a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly. The case has not been decided.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.20_0: The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.7.21_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.1_0: “And how is failure in morality seen, heard, or suspected?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.4_0: ‘Monk so-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.5_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.6_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.7_0: ‘I have been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.8_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.10_0: So-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in morality. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.8.11_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.2_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.3_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.4_0: ‘Monk so-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.5_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.6_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.7_0: ‘I have been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.8_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.10_0: So-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in conduct. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.11_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.12_0: “And how is failure in view seen, heard, or suspected?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.13_0: A monk sees in a monk the characteristics and signs of someone who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.14_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view, but another monk informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.15_0: ‘Monk so-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.16_0: Or a monk doesn’t see a monk who has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view, nor does another monk inform him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.17_0: but the monk himself informs him,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.18_0: ‘I have been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.19_0: Then, on the observance day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, he may if he wishes, based on what he has seen, heard, or suspects, announce in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.20_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.21_0: So-and-so has been seen, heard, or suspected of failure in view. I cancel his hearing of the Monastic Code. The Monastic Code should not be recited in his presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.22_0: This cancellation of the Monastic Code is legitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.23_0: These are the ten legitimate cancellations of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:3.9.24_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.1_0: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.3_0: “Venerable Sir, if a monk wishes to raise an issue, what factors should be fulfilled?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.4_0: “If a monk wants to raise an issue, he should possess five factors.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.6_0: whether or not it’s the right time to raise the issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.8_0: it’s the wrong time, he shouldn’t raise it.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.9_0: But if, while checking, a mendicant knows that
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.10_0: it’s the right time, he should reflect further
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.11_0: whether or not it’s a real issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.13_0: it’s not, he shouldn’t raise it.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.14_0: But if, while checking, a mendicant knows that
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.15_0: it’s real, he should reflect further
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.16_0: whether or not it’s a real issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.18_0: it won’t, he shouldn’t raise it.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.19_0: But if, while checking, a mendicant knows that
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.20_0: it will be beneficial, he should reflect further
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.21_0: that I’ll take care of this self, or do as he was asked.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.23_0: that they won’t, he shouldn’t raise it.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.24_0: But if, while checking, a mendicant knows that
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.25_0: they will take his side, he should reflect further
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.26_0: whether or not raising the issue will lead to arguments and disputes, to fracture and schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.28_0: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.29_0: But if, while checking, a mendicant knows that
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.30_0: those who start argue with schism in the Sangha will not create schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:4.1.31_0: In this way, when five factors are fulfilled, he won’t regret raising it.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.0_0: The qualities to be reflected upon by one who accuses another
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.1_0: “And, Sir, how many qualities should a monk accuse another?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.2_0: “A monk should see five qualities in himself before accusing another.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.3_0: Before accusing another, a monk should reflect,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.4_0: ‘Is my bodily conduct pure and faultless?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.4_1: Is this thing found in me or not?’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.5_0: If it’s not, there will be people who say:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.6_0: ‘Please train your own bodily conduct first.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.7_0: Before accusing another, a monk should reflect,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.8_0: ‘Is my verbal conduct pure and faultless?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.8_1: Is this thing found in me or not?’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.10_0: there will be those who say,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.11_0: ‘Come on, venerable, train your own verbal behavior first.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.12_0: Before accusing another, a monk should reflect,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.13_0: ‘Is my heart established in love for my spiritual companions, or not?’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.14_0: If it’s not, there will be those who say:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.15_0: ‘Please set up a mind of good will toward your fellow monastics first.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.16_0: Before accusing another, a monk should reflect,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.17_0: ‘Have I learned much and do I retain and accumulate what I’ve learned?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.17_1: Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—have I learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.17_2: Is this thing found in me or not?’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.18_1: These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.20_0: Before accusing another, a monk should reflect,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.21_0: ‘Have I properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; have I well analyzed them, thoroughly mastered them, and well investigated them, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition?
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.21_1: Is this thing found in me or not?’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.22_0: If it’s not, then it can be called “ascetics” on both Monastic Codes in detail”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.1.24_0: A monk should see these five qualities in himself before accusing another.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.0_0: The qualities to be set up by one who accuses another
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.1_0: “And, Sir, how many qualities should a monk attend to in himself before accusing another?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.2_0: “A monk should set up five qualities in himself before accusing another. He should think,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.3_0: ‘I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.4_0: I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.6_0: I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.7_0: I’ll speak with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.2.8_0: A monk should set up these five qualities in himself before accusing another.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.0_0: Discussion on the one who accuses and the one who is accused
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.1_0: “Sir, if a monk accuses another illegitimately, in how many ways should regret be aroused in him?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.2_0: “Regret should be aroused in him in five ways:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.3_0: ‘Venerable, you’re accusing at the wrong time, not the right time; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.4_0: You’re accusing falsely, not truthfully; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.5_0: You’re accusing harshly, not gently; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.6_0: You’re accusing unbeneficially, not beneficially; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.7_0: You’re accusing with a mind of good will, not with internal regrets.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.8_0: These are the five ways non-regret should be aroused in a monk who accuses another legitimately.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.3.10_0: So that other monks won’t think to accuse others falsely.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.1_0: “And if a monk has been accused illegitimately, in how many ways should non-regret be aroused in him?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.2_0: “Non-regret should be aroused in him in five ways:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.3_0: ‘Venerable, you have been accused at the wrong time, not the right time; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.4_0: You have been accused falsely, not truthfully; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.5_0: You have been accused harshly, not gently; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.6_0: You were accused harmfully, not beneficially. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.7_0: You were accused with secret hate, not lovingly. There’s no need for you to feel remorse.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.4.8_0: These are the five ways non-regret should be aroused in a mendicant who is accused.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.1_0: “And if a monk accuses another legitimately, in how many ways should non-regret be aroused in him?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.2_0: “Regret should be aroused in him in five ways:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.3_0: ‘Venerable, you’re accusing at the wrong time, not at the wrong time. There’s no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.4_0: You’re accusing truthfully, not falsely; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.5_0: You’re accusing gently, not harshly; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.7_0: You’re accusing with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will; there is no need for you to have regret.’
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.8_0: These are the five ways non-regret should be aroused in a monk who accuses another legitimately.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.5.10_0: So that other monks will think to accuse others truthfully.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.1_0: “And if a monk has been accused legitimately, in how many ways should regret be aroused in him?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.2_0: “Regret should be aroused in him in five ways:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.3_0: ‘Venerable, you have been accused at the right time, not the wrong time; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.4_0: You have been accused truthfully, not falsely; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.5_0: You were accused gently, not harshly. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.6_0: You have been accused beneficially, not unbeneficially; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.7_0: You were accused lovingly, not with secret hate. There’s a reason for you to feel remorse.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.6.8_0: These are the five ways in a mendicant who is accused properly should be chastened in these five ways.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.1_0: “And, Sir, how many qualities should a monk attend to in himself before accusing another?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.2_0: “A monk should attend to five qualities in himself before accusing another:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.3_0: compassion, being of benefit, sympathy, the idea of clearing offenses, and the idea of giving priority to the training.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.4_0: A monk should attend to these five qualities in himself before accusing another.”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.5_0: “And how many qualities should a monk who has been accused set up?”
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.6_0: “A monk who has been accused should ground themselves in two things:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.8_0: The second recitation section is finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.10_0: In this chapter there are thirty topics.

ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.22_0: has many things in the teaching and training.

ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.33_0: Going a four-hundred pieces of grain
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.34_0: Acrossed and thenaments of the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.36_0: In the five kinds of misdeeds
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.37_0: failure in ethics and failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.40_0: Acrossed and thenaments of the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.43_0: but an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.44_0: failure in ethics and failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.47_0: Hence you should train yourselves like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.50_0: So it is these nine analysis
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.52_0: the monk Pārāpariya, who has abandoned the rules,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.55_0: And a Discussion of the opportunity
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.56_0: failure in ethics and failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.57_0: and for the failure in view of one who hasn’t failed.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.62_0: And they say that they’re report to.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.64_0: if she gives her the full admission after getting permission;
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.67_0: The gods of the Thirty-Three, the Brahmā,
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.72_0: and at the time of speaking truth.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.79_0: Or else they dispel him in the same way.
ai-pli-tv-kd19:5.7.83_0: if she is aiming at giving her full admission;
